page.title: 15Interview with headmistress.
page.content: The headmistress of the private school told us the school used to be farm house in 1965. When her sons were small she began to teach them then some people asked if their children could join so she decided to start a nursey school. There are three parts to the school; the nursery school for 2-5 year olds;the junior school for 5-11 year olds, and the senior departments for 11-16 year olds. At 16 they leave. Now there are 400 pupils who travel to the school by coaches or car.There are 38 teachers,5 cooks and 21 cleaners. She has 11 mobile classrooms and cottage houses and a new senior block.Some children go canoeing on their lake and go on skiing holidays to France or Italy.When they are 16 they have G.C.E. exams. They play musical instruments and have a good choir.
